title: [K-12] Cross-Cultural Competency Development Simulation Program for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional methodologies and multicultural education concepts
context.additional_context: Training process for intercultural interaction in real classroom settings through VR-based cultural experience simulations.

learning_goals: Learners analyze perspectives from three or more cultural backgrounds (e.g., Korean, African, Nordic) on given science experiment cases (e.g., climate change, energy use), create a comparison table (including two similarities and two differences), and deliver an oral presentation scoring 4/5 or higher on a peer assessment rubric.
Learners can resolve cultural conflict scenarios in science classes with 80% accuracy.
Learners achieve a score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point scale for intercultural sensitivity indicators in formative assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
